item.title: Jeremiah 1
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 1

1 The Words of Jeremiah Ben-Hilkiah from the Priests at Anathoth in Benjamin

2 Messages from Yahveh came to him in the thirteenth year of Josiah Ben-Amon, king of Judah. 3They came as well during the reign of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, king of Judah, till the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah Ben-Josiah, king of Judah, till Jerusalem’s exile in the fifth month. The Call of Jeremiah

item.title: Jeremiah 2
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 2

1 A Message from Yahveh came to Me: 2"Go proclaim in Jerusalem that Yahveh says, ‘I remember your devotion when you were young, your love as my betrothed, your following me in the open country through uncultivated land.

3 Israel was holy to me, the first fruits of my harvest. Everybody that tried to eat some of it became guilty, and disaster fell on them.’"

4 A Message from Yahveh to the House of Jacob and the Families of Israel

item.title: Jeremiah 3
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 3

1 God says, “If a husband divorces his wife and she marries another man, will he take her back? Wouldn’t that pollute the land? But you’re a prostitute with lots of lovers; yet you turn back to me to get help.

2 Look up at the barren hills; where haven’t you committed adultery? You sit by the roads waiting for them like a nomad in the desert. You pollute the land with your sinful prostitution.

item.title: Jeremiah 4
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 4

1 If you want to come back, you can; get rid of your detestable idols and don’t waver back and forth with them.

2 Swear, ‘As sure as Yahveh lives,’ honestly, justly, uprightly; then the nations will be blessed in him and glory in him." Coming Destruction from the North

3 Yahveh says to the people in Judah and Jerusalem: “Break up your heart’s fallow ground and don’t throw your seed among its thorns.

item.title: Jeremiah 5
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 5

1 Wander back and forth in the streets in Jerusalem; search all around in it. Look in its open squares: if you can find one honest person, one that looks for the truth, I’ll pardon it.

2 Although they swear, ‘As sure as Yahveh lives,’ they don’t mean it.

3 Yahveh, aren’t you looking for honesty? You’ve struck them, but they didn’t feel anything; you’ve consumed them, but they’ve refused to be corrected; they’ve set their faces like stone and refused to repent."

item.title: Jeremiah 6
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 6

1 People of Benjamin, get out of Jerusalem! Blow a bugle in Tekoa, sound the ram’s horn over Beth-haccerem, because great destruction looms down from the north.

2 I’ll destroy attractive, delicate Zion. 3’Shepherds’ [commanders] will lead their companies there and pitch camps around it, each with his own area to subdue.

4 Get ready for war with it; get up! attack at noon! But misfortune would await us; it’s getting late; shadows are getting longer.

item.title: Jeremiah 7
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 7

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah Jeremiah Speaks at the Temple 2"Stand in the entrance to Yahveh’s Temple and deliver this message, ‘Listen to a message from Yahveh, all of you in Judah that go in these gates to worship him! 3If you mend your ways, I’ll let you live here. 4Don’t trust in these deceptive words, “This is Yahveh’s Temple, Yahveh’s Temple, Yahveh’s Temple!” 5If you mend your ways and practice goodness with one another,

item.title: Jeremiah 8
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 8

1 Yahveh says, “At that time, they’ll bring out of their graves the bones of Judah’s kings, its officials, priests, prophets, and the people of Jerusalem. 2They’ll spread them out to the sun, moon, and stars, which they’ve loved, served, and worshiped. They won’t be gathered up or buried. They’ll be like manure on the ground. 3The remnant of this evil family will chose death rather than life. False Prophets 4"Tell them, ‘Yahveh says, “When people fall down, don’t they get back up? When they get off course, don’t they get back on it?"

item.title: Jeremiah 9
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 9

1 Oh that my head was a body of water and my eyes a fountain of tears, so I could weep day and night for my people slain!

2 I wish I had an inn in the desert, so I could escape from my people; because they’re all adulterers, a pack of liars. 3"They bend their tongues like bows; lies, not truth, dominate the land. The people move from one sin to another; they don’t know me. 4"Be leery of your neighbor; don’t trust your own brother, because every brother takes advantage of brother and every neighbor slanders.

item.title: Jeremiah 10
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 10

1 Listen to the message Yahveh’s giving you, Israel: 2"Don’t pick up the ways other nations live; don’t let the signs in the sky terrify you that terrify them.

3 Their customs are delusions. They cut down a tree in the woods, and their craftsmen carve it with a tool;

4 they decorate it with silver and gold and fasten it down with hammer and nails so it won’t shift.

item.title: Jeremiah 11
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 11

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah Judah’s Broken Covenant 2"Listen to this covenant and tell the people in Judah and Jerusalem 3that Yahveh God of Israel says, ‘People are under a curse who ignore the covenant 4that I commanded your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, the iron furnace. I said, “If you listen to what I’m telling you, you’ll be my people, and I’ll be your God.” 5Doing what I tell you confirms the oath I swore to give you a land flowing with milk and honey, like it is now.’" I answered, “Yes, Yahveh."

item.title: Jeremiah 12
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 12

1 You render justice, Yahveh, so I’ll argue my case to you. Why do the wicked prosper, and the devious live in ease?

2 You planted them and they took root; they grew and bore fruit. You’re near their lips but far from their mind.

3 But, Yahveh, you know me; you see me. You examine my attitude toward you. Drag them off like sheep for slaughter; set them apart to be butchered.

item.title: Jeremiah 13
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 13

1 Yahveh told me, “Go buy a linen waistcloth and put it on. Don’t wash it."

2 So I bought one and put it on.

3 Then he said, 4"Take it to the Euphrates and hide it in a crevice in a rock.” 5So I went and hid it there. 6A long time later, Yahveh told me to go get it. 7I went and dug it out of where I’d put it. It was ruined.

item.title: Jeremiah 14
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 14

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah About the Drought 2"In Judah’s towns, commerce has died off at their gates; the people sit on the ground mourning; their outcry goes up from Jerusalem.

3 Nobles send servants to draw water, but the cisterns are dry. They come back with empty pots, demoralized and covering their heads.

4 The ground is cracked because there’s been no rain; farmers are demoralized, too, and cover their heads.

item.title: Jeremiah 15
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 15

1 Then Yahveh told me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were standing here, my heart wouldn’t be with this nation. Send them away! 2If they ask you where to go, tell them Yahveh says, ‘Those destined for death, go to death! Those destined for the sword, go to the sword! Those destined for famine, go to famine! Those destined for captivity, go to captivity!’

3 I’ll send four kinds of destruction on you: the sword to slay, dogs to drag away, buzzards to devour, and scavengers to consume. 4I’ll see that the kingdoms abhor you because of what Manasseh Ben-Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.

item.title: Jeremiah 16
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 16

1 A Message from Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, That Came to Me Day of Disaster 2"Don’t get married or have children here." 3This is what Yahveh says about children born here and their parents, 4"They’ll die from disease, not mourned or buried. They’ll come to an end by sword and famine, and lie like manure on the ground. Their dead bodies will feed the buzzards from the sky and the scavengers on the ground. 5"Don’t go in a house to mourn with people, cry, or console them. From this nation I’ve withdrawn my peace, my enduring love, my mercy. 6From least to greatest will die in the land. There won’t be any friends to bury them, mourn for them, cut themselves, or shave their head for them. 7People won’t offer them a meal to comfort them in mourning or give them a cup to drink to console them for their father or mother. 8Don’t go to sit and eat with them. 9I’m going to eliminate celebration and happiness here, the happy voices of bride and groom. 10"When you tell people that, they’ll say, ‘Why has Yahveh our God declared so much catastrophe on us? What did we do to him?’ 11Tell them, ‘Your ancestors abandoned me for other gods, bowed to them, served them, and didn’t keep my Law. 12You’ve done worse than they did, following your own stubborn hearts and ignoring me. 13So I’m going to expel you from this land to one where you and your ancestors have never been. You’ll serve other gods there because I won’t help you. Hope Despite Disaster 14"The time’s coming when people won’t swear, ‘As sure as Yahveh lives who brought the Israelites out of Egypt.’ 15They’ll swear, ‘As sure as Yahveh lives who brought the Israelites back from the countries up north where he’d banished them.’ I will return them to the land I gave their ancestors. 16"I’ll send lots of fishermen to fish for them, lots of hunters to hunt for them in every mountain, hill, and cave. 17I see what they’re doing; their sin’s not hid from me. 18But first I’ll doubly repay their sin because they’ve polluted my permanent possession with the carcasses of their detestable idols and carved images." Jeremiah’s Praye

item.title: Jeremiah 17
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 17

1 Judah’s sin is recorded with an iron stylus; with a diamond point it’s engraved on their heart and the horns on their altars.

2 As well as they remember their children, they remember their pagan altars and Asherah poles beside every green tree on the tall hills.

3 My mountain in the open country, I’ll give your wealth and treasures for spoil as the price for your sin throughout your territory.

item.title: Jeremiah 18
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 18

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah The Potter’s Shop 2"Go down to the potter’s shop. I’ll give you my message there."

3 When I got down to his shop, he was there, working at his wheel. 4But the jar he was making with his hands didn’t come out the way he wanted; so he made another one out of it that he was satisfied with.

5 Then Yahveh’s message came to me: 6"Israel, can’t I deal with you like this potter did? You’re like clay in my hands. 7At one time I might talk about uprooting, tearing down, or destroying a nation. 8If it turns from its sin, I’ll relent. 9At another time I might talk about planting it or building it up. 10If it doesn’t obey, I’ll change my mind about the good I was going to do for it. 11So tell the people in Judah and Jerusalem, ‘I’m preparing a catastrophe for you. Turn back from your sinful lives, every one of you. Reform your ways and deeds.’ 12"But they say, ‘We’re not going to do that! We’re going to make our own plans and do what we want to!’"

item.title: Jeremiah 19
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 19

1 Yahveh says, “Go buy a clay pot. Take some elders and senior priests along 2to the Valley of (Ben)Hinnom by the entrance to the Potsherd Gate. Deliver my message there, 3’Listen to a message from Yahveh, kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem. I’m about to bring such catastrophe here that will make everybody’s ears ring when they hear about it. 4You’ve abandoned me and made this a foreign place, and burned sacrifices here to gods that you, your ancestors, and the kings of Judah never knew. You’ve filled it with innocent people’s blood 5and built high places for Baal so you can burn your sons as offerings to him. I never commanded that. Such a thing never even entered my mind! 6So the time’s coming when this place won’t be called Topheth or The Valley of (Ben)Hinnom, but The Valley of Slaughter. 7I’ll void the plans that Judah and Jerusalem have. I’ll make them fall by the sword and give their carcasses to buzzards from the sky and scavengers on the ground. 8This city will be desolate, something to gasp at. Everybody that goes by will marvel at its disaster. 9They’ll eat their sons and daughters during the siege and distress their enemies bring on them.’ 10"Then break the pot in front of the men that go with you. 11Say, ‘Yahveh of Hosts says, “Just like a shattered potter’s jug you can’t repair, I’ll shatter this nation and this city. They’ll bury people in Topheth; there won’t be any place else to bury them. [12] 13Their houses, including the kings’ palace, will be defiled like Topheth, because on their roofs they burned sacrifices to the host of heaven and poured out liquid offerings to other gods.”’"

item.title: Jeremiah 20
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 20

1 When Pashhur Ben-Immer, the priest in charge of Yahveh’s Temple, heard Jeremiah prophesying that, 2he had him beaten and put in stocks at the upper Benjamin Gate of the Temple. 3The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah told him, “Yahveh doesn’t call you Pashhur, but The Man Surrounded by Terror. 4He says, ‘I’m going to make you a terror to yourself and your friends. While you watch, they’ll fall by their enemies’ sword. I’ll turn Judah over to the king of Babylon to carry away and kill. 5I’ll turn over this city’s wealth, its produce, its expensive things, the treasures of Judah’s kings to take to Babylon. 6Pashhur, you, everybody in your house, and the friends you’ve falsely prophesied for will go into captivity and be buried in Babylon.’” Jeremiah’s Complaint 7"Yahveh, you’ve deceived me; you’re stronger than I am and have prevailed. I’m a laughingstock all day long; everybody makes fun of me.

item.title: Jeremiah 21
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 21

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah When King Zedekiah Sent Him Pashhur Ben-Malchijah and Zephaniah Ben-Maaseiah, the Priest Jerusalem to Fall to Nebuchadnezzar 2"Inquire from Yahveh for us; Nebuchadnezzar is attacking us. Maybe Yahveh will show us one of his wonderful acts so our enemy will withdraw."

3 Jeremiah told them, “Tell Zedekiah 4that Yahveh God of Israel says, ‘I’m going to make your weapons useless for fighting those who are laying siege outside the wall. I’ll let them come to the center of the city. 5I’ll fight you myself with outstretched hand and strong arm in anger, wrath, and fury. 6I’ll strike down people and animals with a severe plague. 7After that, I’ll turn over to Nebuchadnezzar, Zedekiah, his officials, and people that survive the sword, famine, and disease. He won’t spare, he won’t pity, he won’t have mercy.’ 8"Tell the people Yahveh says, ‘I’m giving you a choice, a way to live and a way to die. 9If you stay in the city, you’ll die by sword, famine, and disease. If you surrender, you’ll have your life as the reward of war. 10I’ve decided to give this city to the king of Babylon to burn.’ 11"Then tell the king of Judah’s household, ‘Listen to Yahveh’s message, 12dynasty of David: “Render justice every morning; deliver from their oppressors those being robbed so my anger won’t flare and burn with nobody to put it out because of your sins. 13"I’m against you, Jerusalem, you that live above the valley in that rocky fortress, you that say, ‘Who can touch us up here? Nobody can break in where we live.’

item.title: Jeremiah 22
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 22

1 Yahveh says, “Go to the king’s palace in Judah and say, 2’Listen to this message from Yahveh, king of Judah on David’s throneâ€”you, your officials, and your people that come in these gates. 3"Be just and good. Deliver from their oppressors those who’ve been robbed. Don’t mistreat foreigners, orphans, or widows, or shed innocent blood here. 4If you do that, kings who sit on David’s throne will come in these palace gates with attendants riding in chariots and on horses. 5If you won’t, I swear by myself that this palace will be empty.”’"

item.title: Jeremiah 23
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 23

1 This is what Yahveh God of Israel says about shepherds that scatter and destroy his sheep instead of tending to them, “I’m about to tend to you for the evil you’ve done. 3But I’ll gather the remnant of my flock out of the countries where I’ve driven them, and bring them back to their pasture to reproduce and multiply. 4I’ll raise up shepherds to tend them. They won’t be afraid anymore, and none of them will go missing. 5"The time’s coming when I’ll raise up a good Branch for David; he’ll reign as King, deal wisely, and carry out justice and goodness in the land.

item.title: Jeremiah 24
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 24

1 Nebuchadrezzar/Nebuchadnezzar took to Babylon Jeconiah/Jehoiachin Ben-Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the officials in Judah along with the craftsmen and artisans. Then Yahveh showed me two baskets of figs sitting in front of the Temple. 2One basket had nice figs in it, like first-ripe ones; the other basket held rotten ones.

3 He said, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I said, “Figs, really good ones and really bad ones you can’t eat because they’re rotten."

item.title: Jeremiah 25
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 25

1 A Message to Jeremiah About the People in Judah in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah (the First Year of Nebuchadnezzar King of Babylon) Seventy Years of Captivity

2 Jeremiah told the people in Judah and Jerusalem: 3"From the thirteenth year of Josiah Ben-Amon, king of Judah, till now (23 years), Yahveh’s message has been coming to me. I’ve spoken to you again and again, but you’ve ignored me. 4He has sent you his prophets over and over, 5’Turn from your sinful ways and deeds, and live on the land I’ve given you and your ancestors forever. 6Don’t worship and serve other gods. Don’t make me angry with what you’ve made with your hands, and I won’t hurt you.’ 7But you ignored me and made me angry with what you’ve made with your hands to your own hurt. 8"‘So, because you haven’t obeyed me, 9I’m going to send for the armies in the north and for Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, my servant, and bring them against this land and surrounding nations. I’ll destroy them, make them something to abhor, to gasp at, a permanent wasteland. 10I’ll take away the joy and happiness, the voices of bride and groom, the sound of millstones, the light from lamps. 11This whole region will be desolate. Those nations will serve the king of Babylon for 70 years. 12"‘When the 70 years are up, I’ll punish the king of Babylon and the Babylonians for their sin. I’ll make it a permanent wasteland 13and bring on it everything I’ve threatened in this scroll that Jeremiah prophesied. 14Many nations and great kings will make slaves out of them too. I’ll pay them back for what they’ve done and their hands have made.’" The Cup of God’s Anger

item.title: Jeremiah 26
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 26

1 A Message from Yahveh at the Beginning of the Reign of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah Jeremiah Escapes Death

2 Yahveh says, “Stand in the court of Yahveh’s Temple and speak to the towns in Judah that have come to worship here. Don’t hold back a word! 3Maybe they’ll listen so I can change my mind about the catastrophe I’m planning for them. 4Tell them, ‘If you won’t follow the Law I’ve given you 5or listen to the prophets I’ve sent you time and again, 6then I’ll make this Temple like Shiloh and this city accursed to every nation.’"

item.title: Jeremiah 27
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 27

1 A Message to Jeremiah from Yahveh at the Beginning of the Reign of Zedekiah Ben-Josiah, King of Judah Jeremiah Wears an Ox Yoke 2"Make yokes and straps and put them on your neck. 3Send back a message to the kings of Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, Tyre, and Sidon by the couriers that come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah. 4Have them tell their masters, ‘Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says, 5"By my power I made the world, its people and animals. I’ll give it to whoever pleases me. 6I’ve given these countries to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, my servant. I’ve even given him the wild animals. 7Every nation will serve him, his son, and his grandson till the time when many nations and great kings make him and his land their servant. 8"Any kingdom that doesn’t surrender and put its neck under his yoke, I’ll punish with sword, famine, and disease. 9Don’t listen to prophets, fortunetellers, dreamers, soothsayers, and sorcerers that tell you not to surrender; 10they’re lying. You’ll be exiled and perish. 11But a nation that puts its neck under his yoke, I’ll let remain on its land, cultivate it, and keep living there."’"

item.title: Jeremiah 28
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 28

1 That same year in the fifth month, fourth year of Zedekiah’s reign, Hananiah Ben-Azzur, a prophet from Gibeon, spoke to me in Yahveh’s Temple with the priests and the people standing there: 2"Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says, ‘I’ve broken the yoke of the king of Babylon. 3Within two years I’ll bring back the articles from Yahveh’s Temple that Nebuchadnezzar took to Babylon. 4I’ll also bring back Jeconiah, king of Judah, and all the exiles from Judah that went to Babylon. I’ll break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’"

item.title: Jeremiah 29
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 29

1 The Letter Jeremiah Sent from Jerusalem to the Rest of the Elders, Priests, Prophets, and People Nebuchadnezzar Had Taken from Jerusalem to Babylon Jeremiah’s Letter to the Exiles (2This was after King Jeconiah/Jehoiachin, the queen mother, the court officials, the other officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen and smiths were deported from Jerusalem.) 3Jeremiah sent the letter by Elasah Ben-Shaphan and Gemariah Ben-Hilkiah, ambassadors Zedekiah, king of Judah, sent to Babylon: 4"Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says to the exiles he’s sent from Jerusalem to Babylon, 5’Build houses and live in them; plant gardens and eat what they grow. 6Get married and have sons and daughters. Take wives for your sons and give your daughters to husbands to have sons and daughters. Multiply there, don’t decrease. 7Look out for the welfare of the city where I’ve sent you. Pray to me on its behalf; in its welfare you’ll fair well. 8Don’t let your prophets and fortunetellers mislead you with their dreams. 9They’re lying in my name. I haven’t sent them. 10"At the end of 70 years in Babylon, I’ll fulfill my promise to bring you back here. 11I know my plans for giving you hope and a future. 12Then you’ll pray, and I’ll listen. 13You’ll look for me and find me when you search with all your heart. 14I’ll restore your fortunes and gather you back to the place I exiled you from. 15"Because you’ve said, ‘Yahveh has raised up prophets for us in Babylon,’ 16this is what I say about the king on David’s throne and about your brothers in this city who didn’t go into exile with you: 17-18I’ll chase them with sword, famine, and disease. They’ll be like burst-open figs no one can eat because they’re rotten. I’ll make them a terror, a curse, something abhorred, to gasp at, a disgrace among the nations where I’ve banished them. 19They didn’t listen when I sent them my prophets time and again. 20So, you exiles that I’ve sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon, listen to what I’m telling you. 21"This is what Yahveh says about Ahab Ben-Kolaiah and Zedekiah Ben-Maaseiah, who are prophesying to you falsely in my name: ‘I’ll deliver them to Nebuchadnezzar; he’ll execute them in your presence. 22The exiles from Judah in Babylon will use this curse, “Yahveh make you like Zedekiah and Ahab that the king of Babylon roasted in fire.” 23They acted foolishly in Israel and committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives. They lied in my name. I’m the One who knows; I see everything that happens.’" A Message for Shemaiah

item.title: Jeremiah 30
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 30

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah A Promise to Restore Israel 2"Yahveh God of Israel says, ‘Write in a scroll everything I’ve told you, 3because the time’s coming when I’ll restore the fortunes of Israel and Judah. I’ll bring my people back to take over the land I gave their ancestors.’"

4 This is what Yahveh said about Israel and Judah: 5"I’ve heard the sound of terror and dread; there’s no peace.

item.title: Jeremiah 31
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 31

1 At that time," Yahveh says, “I’ll be the God of every family in Israel, and they’ll be my people.

2 The people that survived the sword found grace in the desert when Israel was looking for rest."

3 Yahveh appeared to him from afar and said, “I’ve loved you with enduring love; so I’ve drawn you with lovingkindness.

4 I’ll rebuild you, virgin of Israel! You’ll pick up your tambourines again and join the dance.

item.title: Jeremiah 32
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 32

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah in the Tenth Year of Zedekiah, King of Judah (Eighteenth Year of Nebuchadnezzar) Jeremiah Buys a Field 2-3Babylon’s army was laying siege to Jerusalem. Zedekiah had shut Jeremiah up in the courtyard of the guard in the royal palace, and said, “Why do you prophesy that Yahveh says, ‘I’m about to give the city to the king of Babylon. 4Zedekiah won’t escape; the king of Babylon will speak to him face to face. 5He’ll take him to Babylon till I visit him. If you fight the Babylonians, you’ll lose’?"

item.title: Jeremiah 33
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 33

1 Yahveh’s Second Message to Jeremiah While Confined in the Courtyard of the Guard

2 This is what Yahveh says who made the earth, formed and established it: 3"Call out to me, and I’ll tell you important things you don’t know." 4The God of Israel says this about the houses in this cityâ€”including the palace of Judah’s kingsâ€”that were torn down to get materials for defending against the siege mounds and the sword, 5"They’re coming to fight the Babylonians and fill the houses with the corpses of men that in my anger I’ve destined to die. I withdrew because of their sinfulness. 6Later I’ll bring them health and healing, and show them true prosperity and peace. 7I’ll restore the fortunes of Judah and Israel and rebuild them like they were before. 8I’ll cleanse them from their sin against me. 9This city will have a world-wide reputation for joy, praise, and honor to me. The nations will hear about the good I’m doing for it, and tremble at the peace I’m making for it."

item.title: Jeremiah 34
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 34

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah When Nebuchadnezzar, King of Babylon, and His Army and the Kingdoms He Ruled Were Fighting Jerusalem and Surrounding Towns A Warning to Zedekiah

2 Go tell Zedekiah, king of Judah, that Yahveh says, “I’m giving this city to the king of Babylon, and he’ll burn it. 3You’ll be captured and turned over to him. You’ll see him in person, he’ll speak to you directly, and you’ll go to Babylon.” 4But listen to Yahveh, Zedekiah! “You won’t die by the sword; 5you’ll die in peace. As they burned spices for the kings before you, they’ll burn spices and lament, ‘Ah, lord!’ for you. I’ve spoken."

item.title: Jeremiah 35
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 35

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah at the Time of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah The Obedience of the Racabites 2"Go bring the Rechabites to a room in Yahveh’s Temple and offer them wine."

3 I took Jaazaniah Ben-Jeremiah Ben-Habazziniah, his brothers and sonsâ€”the whole family of Rechabitesâ€”4to Yahveh’s Temple to the office for the sons of Hanan Ben-Igdaliah, the man of God. It was close to the officials’ quarters, above the room for Maaseiah Ben-Shallum, the doorkeeper. 5I put pitchers of wine and cups in front of the Rechabites, “Have a drink!"

item.title: Jeremiah 36
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 36

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah, Baruch Reads Aloud Yahveh’s Messages 2"On a scroll, write down everything I’ve told you about Israel, Judah, and the nations from Josiah’s time till now. 3Maybe Judah will listen to the catastrophe I intend to bring on them to get them to repent. Then I’ll forgive their sin."

4 Jeremiah called for Baruch Ben-Neriah, and he wrote down Yahveh’s messages that Jeremiah dictated. 5He told Baruch, “I can’t go to Yahveh’s Temple. 6So you go on a fast day and read to the people the messages you’ve written. Read them to the people in Judah who come from their towns. 7Maybe they’ll turn from their sinful ways and ask for his forgiveness. Yahveh has pronounced great anger against them."

item.title: Jeremiah 37
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 37

1 Zedekiah Ben-Josiah, that Nebuchadnezzar had appointed king in Judah, ruled in place of Coniah Ben-Jehoiakim. 2But he, his attendants, and the people that were left ignored what Yahveh said through Jeremiah.

3 Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal Ben-Shelemiah and Zephaniah Ben-Maaseiah the priest to Jeremiah to say, “Pray to Yahveh our God on our behalf.” 4Jeremiah was still moving freely among the people because they hadn’t put him in prison yet. 5Meantime, Pharaoh’s army had set out from Egypt. When the Babylonians besieging Jerusalem heard about that, they lifted the siege.

item.title: Jeremiah 38
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 38

1 Shephatiah Ben-Mattan, Gedaliah Ben-Pashhur, Jucal Ben-Shelemiah, and Pashhur Ben-Malchijah heard what Jeremiah was telling the people: 2"Yahveh says, ‘If you stay in the city, you’ll die by sword, famine, and disease. If you surrender, you’ll have your life as a reward of war. 3The king of Babylon’s army is going to capture the city.’"

4 The officials told the king, “Execute him. He’s discouraging the fighting men in the city and the people by telling them things like that. He’s not looking out for their welfare, but their harm."

item.title: Jeremiah 39
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 39

1 In the tenth month, ninth year of Zedekiah, king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar came to Jerusalem and began to lay siege to it. 2The ninth day, fourth month, eleventh year of Zedekiah, they breached the wall. 3The officials of the king of Babylon came in and sat down at the Middle Gate: Nergal-sharezer the Samgar, Nebo-sarsekim the Rabsaris, Nergal-sharezer the Rabmag, and the rest. 4When Zedekiah and his soldiers saw them, they fled at night by way of the king’s garden through the gate between the two walls and headed toward the Arabah. 5But the Babylonian army caught up with him in the plains of Jericho. They captured him and took him up to Nebuchadnezzar at Riblah in Hamath, and he passed sentence on him. 6He executed Zedekiah’s sons right in front of him and executed the nobles of Judah. 7Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him in bronze restraints, and took him to Babylon. 8The Babylonians burned the king’s palace and the people’s houses and tore down the walls around Jerusalem. 9Nebuchadnezzar exiled to Babylon the rest of the people in the city and the ones that defected to him. 10Nebuzaradan, captain of the bodyguard, left some people in Judah that didn’t have anything, and gave them vineyards and fields.

item.title: Jeremiah 40
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 40

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah After Nebuzaradan Released Him from Ramah, When He’d Taken Him Bound in Chains Among the Exiles from Jerusalem and Judah That Were Being Exiled to Babylon Jeremiah Freed

2 The captain of the bodyguard took Jeremiah and told him, “Yahveh your God declared this catastrophe on this place. 3He brought it on and did what he declared. Because your people sinned against him and didn’t listen to him, this happened to youpl. 4But I’m freeing yousg from your chains. If you prefer to come with me to Babylon, come along. I’ll take care of you. But if you prefer not to, don’t. The whole land is open to you. Go wherever seems right. 5Go to Gedaliah Ben-Ahikam Ben-Shaphan that the king of Babylon has appointed over the towns in Judah. Stay with him among the people or go somewhere else.” So he gave him a ration and a gift, and released him. 6Jeremiah went to Mizpah to Gedaliah and stayed with him among the people left in the land. Governor Jedaliah Assassinated

item.title: Jeremiah 41
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 41

1 In the seventh month, Ishmael Ben-Nethaniah Ben-Elishama from the royal family and a chief officer of the king, along with 10 men, came to Gedaliah at Mizpah. While they were eating there, 2Ishmael and the 10 men got up and struck down Gedaliah with the sword. 3He also struck down the Jews that were with Gedaliah as well as the Babylonian soldiers there.

4 The next day, before anybody knew what had happened, 580 men came from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria with their beards shaved off, their clothes torn, and their bodies gashed. They had grain offerings and incense to present at Yahveh’s Temple. 6Ishmael went out of Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went. When he met them, he said, “Come in to Gedaliah.” 7But as soon as they came in the city, he and the men killed them and threw them in a cistern. 8But 10 of them said to Ishmael, “Don’t kill us. We have stores of wheat, barley, olive oil, and honey stashed in the field” so he didn’t kill them. 9The cistern that Ishmael filled with corpses was the one King Asa had made because of Baasha, king of Israel. 10Then he took captive everybody left in Mizpah, the king’s daughters, and the remaining people that Nebuzaradan had put under Gedaliah’s charge. He set out with them to cross over to the Ammonites.

item.title: Jeremiah 42
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 42

1 Then Johanan, his commanders, Jezaniah Ben-Hoshaiah, and the people least to greatest came 2to Jeremiah, “Please honor our petition. Pray for us to Yahveh your God for this remnant. There are just a few of us left, as you can see. 3Pray that Yahveh will tell us what we should do."

4 Jeremiah said, “I’ll pray to him and not keep back a word of his answer."

item.title: Jeremiah 43
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 43

1 As soon as Jeremiah finished, 2Azariah Ben-Hoshaiah, Johanan Ben-Kareah, and the arrogant men told him, “You’re lying. Yahveh didn’t say not to go live in Egypt. 3Baruch Ben-Neriah is prompting you to turn us over to the Babylonians so they can execute us or exile us to Babylon.” 4-5So Johanan and the commanders took to Egypt the entire remnant that had come back from the countries where they’d been driven: 6men, women, children, the king’s daughters, everyone Nebuzaradan had left with Gedaliah, together with Jeremiah and Baruch. 7They got as far as Tahpanhes.

item.title: Jeremiah 44
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 44

1 A Message to Jeremiah for the Jews Living in Egypt in Migdol, Tahpanhes, Memphis, and the Territory of Pathros Disaster Because of Idolatry 2"Yahveh of Hosts, the God of Israel, says, ‘You’ve seen the catastrophe I brought on Jerusalem and the towns in Judah; they’re in ruins. Nobody’s living in them 3because their sinfulness made me angry. They kept serving and burning sacrifices to gods they and their ancestors hadn’t known. 4Yet I sent them my prophets time and again, saying not to do that detestable thing. 5’But they didn’t listen, turn from their sin, or quit burning sacrifices to other gods. 6So my anger boiled over and burned in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem.’ 7Now Yahveh says, ‘Why harm yourselves and slay man and woman, child and infant, from Judah and leave yourselves without even a remnant? 8You’ve made me angry with the things you’ve made with your hands and the sacrifices you’ve burned to other gods in Egypt. You’ll be destroyed and become a curse and disgrace among the nations. 9Have you forgotten your ancestors’ sinfulness, the sinfulness of Judah’s kings and their wives, the sinfulness you and your wives committed in Judah and the streets of Jerusalem? 10You haven’t humbled yourselves or respected me to this day or followed the Law and statutes I set before you and your ancestors.’ 11"So Yahveh of Hosts says, ‘I’ll destroy everybody that’s from Judah 12and remove the remnant that’s determined to go live in Egypt. From least to greatest will meet their end here by sword or famine. They’ll become a curse, something abhorred, a disgrace. 13Like I’ve punished Jerusalem, I’ll punish Egypt with sword, famine, and disease. 14Only a few refugees will ever make it back to the land they long to see.’"

item.title: Jeremiah 45
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 45

1 The Message Jeremiah Spoke to Baruch When He’d Written It in a Scroll at Jeremiah’s Dictation in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah A Message for Baruch 2"This is what Yahveh God of Israel says to you, Baruch: 3’You said, “Misfortune awaits me! Yahveh has added sorrow to pain. I’m exhausted from groaning. I can’t sleep.”’ 4Tell him Yahveh says, ‘What I’ve built up I’m about to tear down. What I’ve planted I’m about to uprootâ€”the whole land. 5Are you anticipating great things for yourself? Don’t. I’m going to bring disaster on everybody, but I’ll give you your life as a reward of war wherever you go.’"

item.title: Jeremiah 46
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 46

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah About the Nations

2 A Message to Egypt about Pharaoh Necho’s Army That Was by the Euphrates River at Carchemish, Which Nebuchadnezzar Defeated in the Fourth Year of Jehoiakim Ben-Josiah, King of Judah A Message About Egypt 3"Line up the shields and bucklers, and advance for battle!

4 Harness the horses, mount the steeds, take your positions, put your helmets on! Polish the spears; put on the coats of mail!

item.title: Jeremiah 47
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 47

1 A Message from Yahveh to Jeremiah About the Philistines Before Pharaoh Conquered Gaza

2 Yahveh says, “A flood is swelling up from the north; it will become a tsunami. It’ll flood the land and everything in it, the cities and those who live in them. People will cry out; everybody in the land will wail.

3 Because of the noise of stallions, rushing chariots, wheels, fathers won’t look back for their children; they’ll be too overwhelmed

item.title: Jeremiah 48
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 48

1 About Moab Yahveh of hosts, the God of Israel, says, “Misfortune awaits Neboâ€”laid waste; Kiriathaim will be disgracedâ€”taken; the fortress will be humiliatedâ€”torn down.

2 No more renown for Moab; disaster’s in store for Heshbon to cease being a nation! Put Madmen to silence too; chase it with a sword. 3"An outcry from Horonaim, ‘Devastation and destruction!’

4 Moab’s to be destroyed; its little ones cry out in terror.

item.title: Jeremiah 49
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 49

1 About Ammon Yahveh says, “Doesn’t Israel have any descendants? Doesn’t he have an heir? Why then has Malcam/Milcom taken possession of Gad, and his people settled in its towns?

2 The time’s coming when I’ll raise the battle cry against Rabbah of the Ammonites. It’ll be a desolate mound; its towns will be burned, Then Israel will expel the ones that expelled him. 3"Wail, Heshbon, because Ai is destroyed! Cry out, young women of Rabbah; put on burlap and lament; run back and forth inside the walls. Malcam/Milcom will go into exile along with his priests and officials.

item.title: Jeremiah 50
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 50

1 A Message Yahveh Spoke About Babylon, the Land of the Babylonians, Through the Prophet Jeremiah: 2"Announce it among the nations; hoist a standard everyone can see: ‘Babylon has been captured, Bel humbled, Marduk shattered, its images disgraced, its idols smashed.’

3 A nation has come down against it from the north. It will make the land something to abhor; nobody will live there. People and animals will wander off. 4"At that time, Israel and Judah will return home. They’ll go along weeping, looking for Yahveh their God. 5They’ll ask how to get to Zion and turn in that direction to join Yahveh in an everlasting covenant they won’t forget. 6"My people have been lost sheep. Their shepherds had led them astray and abandoned them on the mountains. They’ve gone along from mountain to hill and lost track of their resting place. 7Everyone that came at them has devoured them. Their enemies have said, ‘We didn’t do anything wrong; they’d sinned against Yahveh, where goodness lives, who was their ancestors’ hope.’ 8"Wander away from Babylon and leave the land of the Babylonians. Be like male goats at the head of the flock. 9I’m going to bring against Babylon a horde of great nations from farther north. They’ll draw up their battle lines and capture it. Their arrows will fly from skilled soldiers that won’t come back empty-handed. 10Babylonia will become plunder. Those who plunder it will gather as much as they want," Yahveh says. 11"Though you’re happy and jubilant now, you that plundered my permanent possession, though you run around like a heifer on grass and neigh like a stallion,

item.title: Jeremiah 51
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 51

1 Yahveh says, “I’m going to stir up the spirit of the destroyer against Babylon and the people in Leb-kamai.

2 I’ll send foreign winnowers to Babylon to devastate its land. On every side they’ll oppose it at the time of its catastrophe.

3 Let the defending archer not bend his bow or stand in his coat of mail. Don’t spare the young men; devote the whole army to destruction.

item.title: Jeremiah 52
item.description:
Jeremiah Chapter 52

1 Zedekiah was 21 when he became king and ruled for 11 years in Jerusalem. His mother was Hamutal Bat-Jeremiah of Libnah. 2He did all the evil Jehoiakim had done. 3Because of Yahveh’s anger over that, he put Jerusalem and Judah out of his presence. Zedekiah revolted against the king of Babylon. 4The tenth day, tenth month, ninth year of Zedekiah’s reign, Nebuchadnezzar came with his army, set up camp against Jerusalem, and built a siege wall around it. 5The city lay under siege till Zedekiah’s eleventh year. 6The ninth day, fourth month, the famine was so severe in the city that the people didn’t have any food left. 7Then they broke into the city, and the fighting men fled at night through the gate between the two walls by the king’s garden, even though the Babylonians were all around the city. They went toward the Arabah, 8but the Babylonian army overtook the king in the plains by Jericho. His whole army scattered from him. 9They captured him and took him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in Hamath, and he passed sentence on him. 10He executed Zedekiah’s sons right in front of him and executed the officials of Judah. 11Then he put out Zedekiah’s eyes, bound him with bronze bonds, and took him to Babylon. He put him in prison till his death. The Temple Burned
